For the release of Moonlight 2 a covenant provided by Microsoft was updated to ensure that other third party distributions can distribute Moonlight without their users fearing of getting sued over patent infringement by Microsoft<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tirania.org/blog/archive/2009/Dec-17.html|title=Releasing Moonlight 2, Roadmap to Moonlight 3 and 4|author=Michael de Icaza|date=2009-12-17|accessdate=2009-12-18}}</ref>. This covenant can be found on the [http://www.microsoft.com/interop/msnovellcollab/newmoonlight.mspx Microsoft website].
For the release of Moonlight 2 a covenant provided by Microsoft was updated to ensure that other third party distributions can distribute Moonlight without their users fearing of getting sued over patent infringement by Microsoft<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tirania.org/blog/archive/2009/Dec-17.html|title=Releasing Moonlight 2, Roadmap to Moonlight 3 and 4|author=Michael de Icaza|date=2009-12-17|accessdate=2009-12-18}}</ref>. This covenant can be found on the [http://www.microsoft.com/interop/msnovellcollab/newmoonlight.mspx Microsoft website].
â
The version of Moonlight that will be available from Novell will have access to licensed media codecs provided for free by Microsoft.
+
The version of Moonlight that will be available from Novell will have access to licensed closed source media codecs provided for free by Microsoft.
Third party distributions of Moonlight will be able to play unlicensed media like Vorbis, Theora and Ogg inside Moonlight (and Silverlight), but for playing back other formats, they will have a few options for licensed media through Moonlight:
